dialogues.text: She takes a folded piece of paper out of her pocket and d it on the dresser as Rocklin watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- See? (opens the door) -- 'Bye now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes. Rocklin stands a moment. Now curiosity b him to the dresser where he takes up the paper and unfold it. CLARA'S LETTER. The torn pieces have all been sorted and  pasted together on a sheet of paper BACK TO SCENE. Rocklin holds the letter. He is mad. He sh his head -- What a gal --- Now he is almost smiling -- al He folds the letter -- puts it in his pocket. Takes off h gun-belt and hangs it over the rocker near the window, an stretches out on the bed, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Clara hurrying toward the front door in a suppressed s of excitement. She has presumably just arrived at the ran in advance of Miss Martin. She enters the house after a g toward the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara enters hastily and beats a path to the door of her  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open. Clara bursts in, closing the door in the same movement. Her eyes swing to someone o.s. and she freezes to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: ON
dialogues.text: Miss Martin, standing by the window, cold and threatening She has not taken the time to remove her hat. After a mom pause, she moves slowly toward Clara. The CAMERA PANS WITH her into a TWO SHOT. Clara, her back pressing harder and harder against the door, becomes more terrified at the other's approach. Miss Martin appraises girl a short moment and now suddenly slaps her hard acros the face. Clara opens her mouth, about to scream, but eve stifles this impulse under the cold stare of her aunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly but viciously) Whatever is to become of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara can only stare as one under an hypnotic spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you no sense of pride, or  decency? Throwing yourself at that --  that wretch, like any shameless hussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara hasn't moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd done with him -- but  no -- you have to run to him and  tell him all our business --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara merely gasps for a breath of air, but Miss Martin,  thinking her about to speak, goes on, more forcefully now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare deny it -- you know  very well you told him about that  letter I wrote Mr. Garvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara, now utterly broken, moves away. Miss Martin, her e still rivited on the girl, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office has been more or less cleaned up since the fig Garvey is discovered near the window. He has cleaned hims up but bears some evidence of the fight. He is reading a  letter as Sammy, the K.C. China-boy, stands waiting near door. LETTER. The message is written in the same bold hand of M Martin already seen in the previous letter: Mr. Garvey, I have just learned that despicable Rocklin person intend to take Clara to Garden City in the morning -- evidently have you investigated. I thought you had better know abou it. E.M. BACK TO SCENE. Garvey puts the message in his pocket as h addresses Sammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Miss Martin that I'll take care  of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You take clare of evelything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Rocklin, stretched across the bed, examining the cards the light of a lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey comes from around the building's corner and peers  furtively through the darkness toward the lighted windows Rocklin's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area in front of the Sun-Up. Dave's wagon pulls up to the hitching rail in front of the saloon. Clint, stripped his gun, is driving with Dave, alertly watching him. They get down from the wagon and Dave prods Clint toward the c of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey has left the spot where we saw him look up to Rock window. We now see him as he rounds a rear corner of the  building and goes toward the outer stairs leading to the Up's second floor. He starts up the steps and stops almos immediately and stares o.s.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: From Garvey's ANGLE as he sees Dave bringing Clint from a in front of the building toward the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA HOLDS
dialogues.text: Garvey steps quickly to the ground and takes up a positio around the roar corner. He watches the two men approach t stairway and go up. He moves out of the shot now, going t the street. The CAMERA HOLDS on the corner, and we see Ta come into view, as though from nowhere, and take the exac position at the building's corner vacated by Garvey only moment before. It is apparent that he is watching Garvey, and after a momentary pause he too moves stealthily out o the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING SHOT on Rocklin asleep. He is fully dressed, as w last saw him, with the exception of his boots. He is stre full length on top of the covers. His gun-belt still hang over the rocker, close to the open window. A knock on the door brings him to a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS TO door as Clint enters reluctantly, followed the triumphant Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is, Rock. Caught him jist in  time near the Santee. Headed fer  out, I'd say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Clint. (to Dave, as he reaches  into his pocket) How about goin' down below an' havin'  one on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses Dave a coin, who catches it. Then Rocklin puts his boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted) Well, now -- that's right thoughtful --  Holler if you need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (belligerently, as he  stands near the window) What's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly, as he stands  up) It ain't gonna do you any good to  get all het up and tough, kid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin begins rolling a cigarette as he moves toward Cli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to ask you a few questions --  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unidentifiable form is seen moving through the darknes toward the outer stairway. As it nears the stairway, the  CAMERA MOVES IN so that as the mysterious figure begins  stealthily up the stairs, we see only the feet through th rungs. The CAMERA THEN PANS QUICKLY AND ZOOMS INTO A CLOSE SHOT Juan, across the alley. And now through Juan's eyes we wa the ascent of the mysterious intruder: The Mexican's line vision gradually raises, then the eyes slowly move across the camera as the dark figure proceeds along to the rear  portion of the verandah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin finishes rolling his cigarette and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you once, I don't know who  owns that pouch-- and I don't know  who shot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Forget it -- that's not what I want  to talk to you about, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harshly) Well, what do you want to talk about?  Come on, get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mysterious form has moved past the darkened windows a the verandah and is nearing Rocklin's lighted room -- sto close to the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT -- Rocklin and Clint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint -- I want you to tell me why  Garvey murdered Red Caldwell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint tenses -- stares -- finds breathing difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking) Me? No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes you do. (advancing on him) And you're going to tell me all about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know nothing, I tell you --  I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin slaps Clint's face open-handed, throwing him off  balance, then grabs him by the shirt front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell ya, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting him again) Talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely terrified, Clint opens his mouth as if about t speak. Suddenly he sees something out of the shot over  Rocklin's shoulder and his expression changes. Rocklin lo quickly in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: window. A gloved hand has come out of the dark and is rea through the window for Rocklin's gun in the belt which is hanging over the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clint and Rocklin. The latter is still looking toward the window. With a swift movement Clint picks up the water ju from the washstand and brings it down on Rocklin's head. Rocklin falls out of shot, Clint turns to the window with triumphant smile. Suddenly his expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a hoarse scream) No! No, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a shot from o.s. and Clint's hands go to his sto With a gasp of pain he doubles up and collapses on the fl

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: window. The hand of the killer pitches the gun toward Roc and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lined up at the bar are Dave, Pap Fossler, Shorty Davis a a few others. Cap is in his usual place. At the poker tab are Doc Riding, Sam Haynes, Ab Jenkins and one or two oth The shot has evidently been heard, for everything seems t have stopped, and Dave and Pap Fussier are looking up tow the ceiling, as are others. Now Dave snaps back to life - gulps down his drink, and hurries toward the stairs. As h starts up, the others move slowly in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin is on the floor, groggy. He shakes his head, and his senses return, he picks up the gun and just gets to h feet as Dave rushes in. Dave sees Clint's body on the floor -- notices the gun in Rocklin's hand. He opens his mouth to speak but nothing c out. All he can do is stare and grimace. The sound of hur feet comes from the hall, and presently the mob closes in crowding the room and the hall. Pap Fossler, who has been one of the first to enter, knee over Clint. During this, there are general ad libs from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Who is it? Clint  Harolday -- Etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Doc Riding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the Doc. Hey, Doc -- He was down  below. Here he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc's voice is heard from the hall as he makes his way th the jam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out, men -- Let the Doc through.  Etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc riding comes through the crowd, kneels beside Pap Fos He needs only a glance to know he can be of no use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking the silence) Somebody better fetch Harolday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shorty's already gone for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) Better get Arly, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice is heard from the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was at the hotel a while ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at Clint  and shaking his head) He was only a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin, still holding his gun as he stares down at Clint body o.s. Now he studies the faces of the mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the crowd. There is nothing but a sea of hostile faces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on here -- gang way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd parts to admit Jackson, who comes stalking in  followed by Judge Garvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the trouble here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops abruptly as he sees Clint's body. Now he levels eyes on Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a bitter smile) I warned you, didn't I? -- Well, I  guess this is the last trouble you'll  ever make in this town. (extending his hand) Hand over that gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute, now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps back so no one is behind him. And there is somet about his manner and tone that urges Jackson to use  discretion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crowd,  generally) I know it looks bad -- but I didn't  kill the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd stares in skeptical silence. Even Dave thinks  Rocklin is lying, and now does his best to protect his fr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. (to the others) His gun was layin' over there on the  floor when I come in and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) No it wasn't -- It was right in my  hand -- like it is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you didn't know him -- then who  did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- (looks at garvey) But I'm going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harolday, followed by Shorty Davis, is making his way dow the hall from the inner stair landing. As he nears the cr gathered at Rocklin's door, Juan comes into view down the hall, having just entered through the door leading out on the verandah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he nears Rocklin's  door) Where is he? -- Where's my boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harolday enters, over the ad libs of the mob, followed by Shorty Davis. During the following action, Juan enters an stands near the door, silently taking in everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harolday, as he sees Clint's body and stops dead in horro He turns to Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with cold violence) You murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it, Mr. Harolday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Then who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from crowd) He had a gun in his hand when we  come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smoothly) And I'll bet it's the same one the  bullet that killed Clint came out  of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin gives Garvey a hard, slow look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you say to that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You admit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- but that still don't say I  killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, take him away -- Liar -- Lock  him up, Sheriff -- The yellow-bellied --  Etc.

dialogues.speaker: ON ARLY AS SHE PUSHES HER WAY THROUGH THE CROWD
dialogues.text: She stares down at Clint. An expression of pity comes ove her. Now she looks coldly at Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Rocklin in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He admits it was his gun that shot  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whose eyes haven't  left Rocklin's) But you didn't fire it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) Clint and me was having a bit of an  argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) What about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching for words) About whether he was going to help  clear up a few things that's been  bothering me and some others 'round  these parts. (looking at Garvey) For instance -- who it was shot Red  Caldwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caldwell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still at Garvey) And the K.C. foreman. And who took  that shot at me up at Table-Top last  night. And why certain people are so  anxious to get rid of the Caldwell  girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would Clint know about all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harshly) He's lying. He's trying to cover up  for killing my boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (encouraged by the  support) Quit stalling, Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a tentative movement toward Rocklin but Arly  intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute -- he's get a right to  be heard. (to Rocklin) Well, we're listenin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- Clint was getting' all set  to talk, when -- somebody snuck up  along the verandah there and pulled  the gun out o' my belt... (indicating the belt  on chair) ... and let him have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a moment's amazed silence. Then the crowd breaks into derisive comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a story! What an alibi! String  him up, the heel! Etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) You'll have to think up something  better than that Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Garvey in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smoothly) Don't be a fool, Rocklin. You know  you can't get away with a yarn like  that. Why don't you save yourself  and everyone else a lot of trouble  by surrendering to the Sheriff? After  all, it isn't such a crime in these  parts to kill a man in self-defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Self-defense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone knows what Clint was like.  He probably lost his head and pulled  a gun on you, like he did at the Sun- Up that night. Wasn't that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly; after a little  pause) No, that wasn't it. And till I do  what I got to do, I ain't surrenderin'  to anybody -- least of all to your  pal here. (indicates sheriff) If I got to be shot for knowing too  much, it ain't going to be in the  back, in a framed-up jail-break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly, who has been staring at Rocklin in frowning  bewilderment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if someone's trying to kill you,  why didn't they do it just now? Why  did they have to kill Clint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess they wanted to get Clint, too.  Doin' it this way they get us both.  Clint first -- an' me afterwards --  like I jus' said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Garvey in f.g. Close beside him are Pap and Dave, wh watches Garvey closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit fancy talk. Who's "they?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might be able to tell you that  later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) No you won't -- because you're comin'  with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises his gun) Am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd tenses. Rocklin eyes them grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first one that moves -- gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves over to the open window, and with his gun levele on the mob, steps out onto the verandah. Once outside, he suddenly lets the window fall and disappears. A shot from Jackson's gun shatters a pane, during which time there ha been a rush to the window. It is Arly and Dave who reach first, and feigning an attempt to raise the window, they  momentarily delay pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR LEADING FROM THE ROOM
dialogues.text: There is the inevitable jam as the pushing, yelling crowd all try to exit at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin, as he picks himself off the ground, having dropp from the verandah. He starts quickly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING INTO the room, we see Arly and Dave shoved to on side by Jackson and Garvey. The window goes up and Jackso steps out, followed by Garvey, Harolday, Arly, Dave, and  others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The human jam has been broken, and now the mob dashes wil toward the stairway, and verandah exit in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hitching rail in front of the Sun-Up. There are a doz or so horses tied up to it and close to it is Dave's team and wagon. Rocklin comes from around the corner of the  building and races to the hitching rail.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF OUTSIDE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Jackson and Garvey come from around the corner of the por followed by Harolday, Arly, Dave, and others. At the stai they collide with some of the men who have raced down the hall, only to reach the stairway at the same moment. Ther is another jam on the landing as the mob all try to get d at once.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKLIN AT THE HITCHING RAIL
dialogues.text: He has cut the lines of the horses tied to the rail. We s him cutting the last line and fire into the air. The hors rare and stampede.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: And now there is a state of utter confusion as the mob an horses rush in all directions as the men try to retrieve  their mounts. Rocklin is no where in evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Well, Sheriff -- you certainly are  to be congratulated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harassed) Look, Mr. Harolday -- you saw what  happened --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply concerned) Never mind that -- Let's get going  for Garden City -- that's where he's  headed for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave climbs into his wagon behind the group as Jackson ex quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At hitching rail. There are four or five horses tied up h Arly and Juan enter and mount their horses, and almost  immediately Garvey and Harolday come hurrying into the sc after two of the other horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts from her horse) Where do you think he's gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before either of the two men can answer, Jackson's voice heard shouting o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, men -- follow me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS AROUND, getting Jackson, now mounted, as  others come riding in. He rares his horse around and star away followed by the mob, including our principals. They not get very far when Dave's wagon comes into the shot, g hell-bent in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse riding hard, with Dave's wagon following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, half standing as he urges his team on. Behind him a the closed flaps of the wagon top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a hand reaches out from between the flaps and grasps t reins. Dave takes it, and looks wildly around -- falls ba on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: ON ROCKLIN
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK to include Dave, smiling broadly. Rockl is pulling hard on the reins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mighta knowed you'd do somethin'  like this. (as Rocklin slows the  team) What are we doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headin' for the K.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that Rocklin starts swinging the team around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy, the China-boy, is nervously knocking on Miss Marti door. It opens and Miss Martin is seen slipping a robe ov her long Mother Hubbard nightgown, with cap to match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Now -- what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy points o.s. -- Miss Martin looks and freezes. As she moves down the hall, the CAMERA PANS WITH her unti it gets two men standing near the entrance door. Now the CAMERA MOVES IN TO A THREE SHOT and we recognize  George Clews and his brother, Bob. Bob, his wrist bandage takes off his hat at Miss Martin's approach, and George  noticing, does likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name's Clews, ma'am -- Mr. Garvey  sent us out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Said you were expectin' trouble with  that Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. (acidly to George) -- But I'm wondering if you're up to  it. I noticed you didn't fare so  well with him yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was drunk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Yeah -- But I'm sober now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, see that you stay that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, ma'am -- I've jus' bin  waitin' to get even with that saddle- bum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with that oily smile) We'll be close-by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidently) You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara is seen in her nightgown, listening at the door to room. The sound of the outer door closing comes over the  scene and she hurries to her bed and feigns sleep, and ju in time, for the door opens and Miss Martin sticks her he in, and satisfied that Clara is sleeping, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raspy voice is heard coming out of the darkness singing ribald song of the periods. And now Old Zeke, riding his  burro, comes into view. As he passes close to the camera, PAN and get the posse coming out of the darkness in the  opposite direction Zeke is travelling. As the posse pulls up to Zeke, the CAMERA MOVES IN on a g including Zeke, Jackson, Garvey, Harolday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen anybody ridin' hard for Garden  City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bin on the road since sundown --  ain't seen a livin' soul -- be he  man or beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mighta taken the cutoff through  Jaw Bone Canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that storm? -- He'd never make  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one other place he might  have gone -- the K.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very definitely) I'm positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to the posse  milling around) To the K.C., men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse swings around and starts back toward Santa Inez

dialogues.speaker: ARLY AND JUAN
dialogues.text: Arly watches the posse, then turns to Juan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Take me through the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dangerous, senorita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if we get through we'll beat  them to the K.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would risk your life for Senor  Rocklin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly does not answer in words. But Juan sees the answer i her eyes. Now she tosses her head defiantly and swings he horse off the road in the direction of the canyon. Juan  watches a moment, then spurs his mount after her, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Clara, tossing fitfully in her bed. Suddenly she sits as an idea begins to take form in her mind. Now she hurri out of bed, moves stealthily to the door and goes out, le her door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON door to Miss Martin's room. Clara comes down the hall the door. She puts her ear close and listens. Now she ope it cautiously and peers inside. The door to her room is  slammed o.s. by a sporadic draft. It startles the girl an she quickly closes Miss Martin's door and hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON the posse, riding hell-bent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly and Julio, as they slowly pick their way along the  difficult trail, skirting a roaring torrent. Julio is lea and close behind him Arly is having a time negotiating th unsteady ground of a landslide.

dialogues.speaker: PORTION OF JAW BONE CANYON
dialogues.text: She notices Julio staring o.s. and slowly shaking his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julio nods his head slowly, deliberately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only for you -- you must not do this --  I will go through from here alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint smile of admiration brushes Arly's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, -- we're going through together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly lashes her horse away. Julio realizes the futileness further pleading and now moves his horse out after Arly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wagon with Dave and Rocklin coming out of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is driving the team for all it is worth. Rocklin is  looking back. He turns to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can ease up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just about there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wooden gate is swung closed across the roadway. On the  gate is a crudely printed weather-beaten sign: K.C. RANCH Over the scene comes the SOUND of the wagon approaching.

dialogues.speaker: THE WAGON PULLS UP TO THE GATE
dialogues.text: Rocklin hops out, opens the gate. Dave drives the wagon  through. As Rocklin lets go the gate, it swings closed of its own accord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shed is a short distance from the Caldwell house. Bob Clews is standing at a corner of the shed looking o.s. Ov the scene comes the SOUND of the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering into shed) Hey, George -- George, get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wagon moving slowly through the cottonwoods, along th drive not far from the house. It stops now, and the CAMER MOVES CLOSER to get Dave and Rocklin as they leave the te and start stealthily toward the house seen in the moonlig in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pick up Clara in the act of nervously pinning on her h in the dim light of a small lamp. She is fully dressed, a once the hat is on, she looks around anxiously for her to coat which she finds in the closet. She takes the coat an starts hurriedly toward the lamp, sitting on a small tabo near the door. As she bends over to blow it out, her eyes raise and she freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ICILY FOR A LONG MOMENT
dialogues.text: Now she snaps the door closed without removing her eyes f Clara, and starts forward. The CAMERA PULLS BACK to include the two. Clara stands as one under an hypnotic spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a very low tone) You vile, ungrateful strumpet --  running away in the night, like a  deceitful sneak-thief --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unrestrained) Yes -- I'm running away -- and it's  all your fault -- you're the one  who's been deceitful and sneaking --  and don't think I don't know what  you intend doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very controlled) -- And don't think I don't know what  you intend doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying, as she moves  away) I don't care -- I'm not ashamed of  it -- and nothing you can say or do  is going to stop me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hardly above a whisper) You little fool -- if you go to Garden  City with that man -- you stand to  lose everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops pacing) But why? -- Why are you being so  secretive? -- If you know something,  why don't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods and mumbles to  himself) Yeah -- why don't you? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin quickly shushes Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Unmindful of the  presence of the men) All right, I'll tell you -- Rocklin  is a nephew of the late Mr. Caldwell.  And, as nearest of kin, he stands to  get everything -- according to the  will. Because you are not the old  man's niece, but only his grand-niece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin turned up unexpectedly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you and Mr. Garvey knew the truth  all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Dave keeps quiet any longer he'll burst. He spins Rock around and speaks in his natural voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And you knew the truth all the  time, too -- didn't you? -- No wonder  you stuck around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Rocklin's expression it is quite apparent to Dave th he is right.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA AND MISS MARTIN
dialogues.text: Both women are staring dumbly toward the window. Now the  realization that she has been overheard staggers Miss Mar She utters a stifled scream and, seeing Rocklin starting  through the window, runs from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in here and take care of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave scrambles through the window and hurries in pursuit Miss Martin. Rocklin is at Clara's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bushes near the house. George and Bob Clews are crouched, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse riding hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Arly and Julio as they descend a steep embankment  toward the raging torrent. They both are riding Julio's h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly and Julio; Arly seated behind Julio, considerably  disheveled and sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comfortingly) You are crying, senorita --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying bravely) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows she is) It is too bad we lose your horse.  She was good horse, for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only we make it in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move away into a longer shot, a huge boulder come crashing down the canyon side, across their path, and tum with a great roar and splash into the torrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara is talking feverishly to Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And I heard one of them tell my  aunt not to worry, that he was just  as anxious as she was to get even  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave enters from the hall carrying Miss Martin over his  shoulder. He has her wrapped in a sheet and bound up in  tassled curtain cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Clara and Rocklin  react) This is the only way I could handle  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clews are around here some place --  Garvey sent 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Bob Clews at the window. George has his gun  leveled, and a dirty smile twists his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet we're around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PULLS BACK as George Clews climbs into the roo followed by Bob. They disarm both Rocklin and Dave as Cla watches helplessly, and Miss Martin struggles in her wrap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob) Untie her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dave) Untie her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave puts Miss Martin down and begins undoing her as Bob  covers him with his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse riding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly and Juan leave the hazardous trail behind and now st across the flat on a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave has unwrapped Miss Martin and she gets to her feet  bristling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob) Now tie him up. (indicates Dave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly, as she picks  up the tassled cord) I'll take part in this -- you -- you  hairy beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Clews tosses the sheet over Dave's head. And as Dave  struggles,

dialogues.speaker: ROCKLIN AND GEORGE CLEWS
dialogues.text: Rocklin thinks he has George off guard and makes a pass a him. But George is on the alert and strikes Rocklin on th head with his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: ON CLARA AS ROCKLIN GOES DOWN
dialogues.text: She utters a choked cry and falls to the floor in a faint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Miss Martin comes to Clara and kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me get her to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the room. Bob Clews has Dave securely tied, and now as Miss Martin in getting Clara to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Rocklin  on the floor) What'll we do with 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them in to Mr. Garvey and tell  him I must see him at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphantly) We'll dump them right in the Judge's  lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Clews picks up the unconscious Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still administering  to Clara) Hadn't you better tie him, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob, after a  second's pause) Get some more rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob hurries to do so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse riding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's wagon. Bob Clews is seen dumping Dave into the rea of the wagon. George Clews stands near him with Rocklin's unconscious form over his shoulder. Now he puts Rocklin i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get our horses and meet me at the  gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob runs after the horses. George gets onto the wagon sea swings the team around and heads for the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly and Juan riding hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Clews sits in the wagon waiting for Bob, who now c out of the darkness with their horses. He dismounts, ties the horses to the back of the wagon, comes around in fron to the gate. He is about to swing it open when he looks p the camera at Arly and Juan, who now pull up to the outsi of the gate. Arly dismounts quickly, her gun in her hand. Bob Clews backs up toward the wagon as Arly walks through gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Arly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Clews on the wagon seat. He is smiling and is goin to try to bluff it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Arly) What are you doin' with that gun,  Arly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down from there before I show  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin has regained consciousness and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen, Arly -- this ain't your  wagon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither is it yours -- Get down out  of there -- before I knock you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin recognizes Arly's voice. Now he raises himself up over the tailboard and falls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses tied in back shy as Rocklin falls to the groun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly, as she takes it and starts toward the rear of the w

dialogues.speaker: HIS GUN
dialogues.text: He no more than gets it out when a knife whirls in from o getting him in the small of the back.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN
dialogues.text: He sits calmly astride his horse, his gun leveled on Geor Clews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly is cutting the rope binding Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And they're headed this way and  should get here any minute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin gets to his feet. Arly notices something shining the ground where Rocklin lay. She picks it up. It is the  tobacco pouch with the steer's head of hammered silver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the pouch) That belongs to the man who shot at  me on Table-Top -- Dave found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Dave's Wrapped form, kicking the wagon tailboard. Arly head appears between the flaps above the tailboard and as Dave groans and kicks, she takes her knife and slits the  rope binding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin has come to George clew and we see him wrest the from his hand and yank George down from the wagon seat. O down, he lets him have a hard right that sends him sprawl

dialogues.speaker: IN
dialogues.text: They start fighting viciously. Arly rushes in crying wild

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to stop Rocklin) You've got to get away -- they'll be  here -- they'll catch you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin. There is but one thought in his enraged mind --  Clews. He tears into him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantically) You've got to stop him -- he's got  to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin, Arly, Dave, Rocklin is about done in from the fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously) Come on -- let's git goin' --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he walks to wagon) Where's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't time -- they're coming --  don't you believe me? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dave) Come on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly's plea goes unheeded and he starts away toward the h on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters) Stubborn as an ole mule. (shouts) You're puttin' a rope around your  neck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave runs after Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him -- (indicates Bob Clews) -- out of sight, and follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes up the reins now and swings the team around and off the road into the thickness of the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin and Dave. They are approaching the house warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) But what'll we do with the ole lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to pizen her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly is seated on the wagon seat looking toward the gate Juan comes in on his horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing o.s.) Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At gate. The posse rides up. The gate is swung open and t ride through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At wagon. Arly jumps to the ground and speaks to Juan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she starts toward the house, Juan dismounts and follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse comes riding in. Jackson, Garvey, Harolday, and few others dismount and go toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: ARLY AND JUAN
dialogues.text: as they move stealthily into a spot shielded by undergrow which gives them full view of the front and one side of t house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martin is coming into the room with a glass and a pi for Clara, who is still stretched on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll just take this -- you'll  go to sleep --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of someone knocking on the front door comes ove the scene. Miss Martin exits hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At front door. Miss Martin opens the door, confronting Ja and the group. She is bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evenin' ma'am -- hate to bother you  like this, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Garvey,  interrupts) I'm so glad you've come, Mr. Garvey,  the most awful -- (as though seeing the  crowd for the first  time) -- Why -- what are all these people  doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're after Rocklin -- has he been  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smugly) Oh yes -- here and gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astounded) Gone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphantly) Yes -- the two men you sent out are  taking him and that horrid old man  back to town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clewses -- funny we didn't see  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' musta gone wrong -- We  better fan out and see what's goin'  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Don't leave, Mr. Garvey -- I've got  to talk with you, privately --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As all but Garvey and Harolday go back to their horses, G speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, madam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey looks at Harolday in a manner evidencing his dista and impatience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go on and meet you in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd better. (calls to Jackson  o.s.) I'll meet you in town, Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right -- come on, men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of running horses comes over the scene as Harol hurries away and Garvey enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: ON HAROLDAY AS HE GOES TO HIS HORSE
dialogues.text: He starts to mount, but instead leads the horse into the  bushes close to where Juan and Arly are watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martin and Garvey have been talking. Garvey paces  nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly, as he turns  to Miss Martin) -- And you're positive he knows  everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely everything -- He was  standing at the window all the time --  the scoundrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin has his ear glued to the door. He can't help but  smile at Miss Martin's reference to him. Dave is behind t curtain at the window, watching the outside. Clara is clo to Rocklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) You better get back on the bed -- in  case they come in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara tiptoes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly and Juan, as they watch Harolday approach the house go to the hall window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey and Miss Martin. Garvey is still pacing very nervo He is trying to think of his next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were to ask me, I think the  best thing to do is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey stops and glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritably) I'm not asking you -- and don't bother  me with your silly questions -- we've  got to do something besides talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing herself up) You mean -- you have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey stops and looks at her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This was all your idea, remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tossing it off) My idea -- that's all you know about  it.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR TO CLARA'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: It is open and Rocklin stands there looking o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's anybody else in on it --  speak up, Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- I do declare --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can say no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin steps away from the door, where Dave and Clara no stand. He has Garvey covered. Dave is pointing his gun, a grimacing at Miss Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At hall window -- on Harolday watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey is stepping back, in a cold sweat, toward Miss Mar as Rocklin advances toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garvey, quite  casually) Talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martin opens her mouth, about to speak.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: of Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blasting, to Miss  Martin) Not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Martin. Her mouth snaps shut like a trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garvey, Rocklin, Miss Martin. Rocklin takes the tobacco p out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garvey) Ever see that before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blanches) No -- it's not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me whose it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking) No -- no -- I don't know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harolday at hall window. He raises his gun -- he is about fire when a knife whirls out of nowhere and sticks in the window frame, inches from Harolday's head. He spins aroun and stares wildly here and there at the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no one in evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop that gun.

dialogues.speaker: LOCATE THE VOICE
dialogues.text: He drops the gun. Arly and Juan come in to him. Arly has covered. The CAMERA PULLS BACK to a WIDER ANGLE, getting the front door as it is opened by Rocklin, who evidently heard Arly

dialogues.speaker: AT FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Arly is prodding Harolday into the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rocklin) He was just getting ready to finish  you off, through that window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harolday is herded inside, close to Garvey and Miss Marti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost enjoying this) You seem to like to do business  through windows, Mr. Harolday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pause Harolday remains sneeringly silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Clint's killer, by any  chance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) By one bad chance -- (glares at Harolday) Juan saw you do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harolday looks at Juan, who slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now we're gettin' some place --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings up the tobacco pouch. But before he can ask abo it, Arly speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That pouch is his -- (indicates Harolday) Juan made it for him a long time  ago. (to Juan) Didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan nods. Rocklin, with a sudden transition, speaks to Harolday in hard, threatening tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harolday) Why did you kill Caldwell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harolday doesn't answer. He finally looks at Garvey in  desperation. Perspiration runs down Garvey's forehead.  Suddenly Harolday makes a mad dash for the door. Rocklin  shoots, but Arly pushes his arm and sends the shot wild.  Rocklin looks at her in amazement. Julio hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Harolday as he rushes madly across the clearing toward the bushes where his horse waits. The CAMERA SWINGS BACK to the porch in time to catch Juli crossing it in pursuit of Harolday. Arly and Rocklin come through the open door and stand on the porch watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see Julio disappear in the brush. For a moment nothi happens; now Harolday's horse bolts out, riderless, and  gallops away. Now Julio comes slowly into view. He moves  slowly and deliberately back toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: AT PORCH
dialogues.text: Julio comes in to Rocklin and Arly. The three exchange  significant glances as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hall are Clara and Miss Martin, Rocklin, Arly and  Julio, Dave and Garvey. Garvey is seated and has evidentl been talking in the way of confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Harolday wanted the K.C. like he  wanted the Santee and the Hardman  place, for his land scheme -- He  planned on breaking up the ranches  into small holdings and selling to  dirt farmers. He pretended to be on  the outs with me so I could get  Caldwell's confidence. And when Red  caught me with the crooked cards and  threatened to expose me -- Harolday  shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he kill Clint? An' not me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shot was an accident -- it was  meant for you. We planned on getting  the women to let me handle their  business --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting, furious) -- And do us out of everything -- (moves close to Garvey) You vile -- wicked -- despicable --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is beside herself in her anger -- and taking up a lar vase sitting nearby, she smashes it to pieces over Garvey head. Garvey goes down unconscious. Miss Martin rushes to her room screaming. Clara follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he wakes up -- we'll have him  put everything on paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'll have to do the writin' --  'cause I don't know how to write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely concerned) Oh, Mr. Rocklin -- please -- I think  Auntie is out of her mind -- she's  in her room -- laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimaces) What that ole pelican needs is a  good spankin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (who has been silently  listening) And I'll bet you're just the one who  can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his eyes flash with  an idea) Yeah -- I believe I am. (looks at the group) I know I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts away down the hall, rolling up his sleeves.  Rocklin's eyes wander to Clara, who seems quite at a loss Now he moves slowly toward her. In the b.g. Arly watches  Rocklin's every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess there's no rush for you to  get to Garden City, now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a slight pause in which she becomes conscious of Ar Clara speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I don't suppose there's any --  rush --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another short pause. Rocklin glances at Arly, an Arly assuming they want to be alone, turns and goes out t door, leaving Julio attending Garvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after Arly goes) If I was like her, I'd stay in the  West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means you're goin' back East --  Cousin Clara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, nods) It's where I belong -- I know that  now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to know where you Belong,  I reckon -- Wish I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistfully) I can tell you -- you belong with  her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocklin takes it -- a faint smile brushes his face. He tu now and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arly is seated on the shaft of an old wagon. The first ra of the morning sun streak through the trees across her as she smiles wistfully down at the antics of a little woodc cavorting on the ground close to her. In a moment Rocklin comes into view in the b.g. He spots Arly, who has her ba to him, and walks over. His approach frightens the woodch away, and turns Arly's head toward him. Neither has anyth to say. Now Rocklin sits beside Arly, but faces the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another stilted pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her eyes sweeping  the morning) Beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reflecting) It didn't start out so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true of lots of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fer instance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Well -- you and -- me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another pause. But worlds are being said in the  language of eyes. Their heads move closer and now Rocklin arms sweep around the girl and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Hey, Rock -- Rock -- get out your  pencil and paper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two stop abruptly and look o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimacing) Doggone it -- here Garvey is back in  this world -- an' they're out of it.
